title: What Does "FYP" Mean? (Plus, How to Get on TikTok's FYP)

steps.title: The acronym â€œFYPâ€ is short for â€œFor You Pageâ€ on TikTok.
steps.content: The acronym â€œFYPâ€ is short for â€œFor You Pageâ€ on TikTok. The â€œFor You Pageâ€ is basically the homepage of the app, allowing users to discover new content. While TikTok hasnâ€™t revealed how their algorithm curates content for the FYP, many users believe they analyze your likes and behavior and then use that information to recommend relevant videos. [1] X Research source Instagram and X refer to this personalized content feed as the â€œExploreâ€ page, while Snapchat calls it â€œDiscover.â€

steps.title: TikTok users comment #FYP on their videos to boost their visibility.
steps.content: TikTok users comment #FYP on their videos to boost their visibility. For content creators and influencers, using the hashtag is a great strategy to increase their followers , reach, and engagement rate. It may help their content reach a wider audience (and possibly go viral), so many users caption their videos with #FYP, #foryou, or #foryoupage. [2] X Research source Viewers can also comment #FYP to further promote the content or let others know that itâ€™s being widely circulated on the app. Research shows that 81% of TikTok users discover new brands and products on the platform, so landing on someoneâ€™s FYP can be extremely beneficial for businesses. [3] X Research source Some users are concerned that the FYP may spread misinformation since social media companies can manipulate what they view and interact with.

steps.title: Create short, high-quality videos.
steps.content: Create short, high-quality videos. TikTok rewards videos that users watch from start to finish, so aim to create content thatâ€™s quick, interesting, and engaging. Experiment with different video lengths to see which ones are the most successful, and edit your future videos for speed and clarity. [4] X Research source If you frequently add voice overs to your videos, you might want to invest in an external microphone that eliminates background noise.

steps.title: Maintain a consistent posting schedule.
steps.content: Maintain a consistent posting schedule. In general, itâ€™s best to post 1-4 times a day on TikTok. However, this may vary depending on the type of content youâ€™re creating and your target audience. [5] X Research source If youâ€™re serious about growing your account and getting on the FYP, switch to a TikTok pro account so you can analyze the times your followers are most active. Or, create a social media calendar with deadlines for all your videos. [6] X Research source According to studies, the best times to post on TikTok in the United States (EST) are: [7] X Research source Monday: 12 PM and 4 PM Tuesday: 4 AM, 8 AM, 10 AM, and 3 PM Wednesday: 1 PM and 2 PM Thursday: 5 AM, 3 PM, and 6 PM Friday: 1 AM, 11 AM, 7 PM, and 9 PM Saturday: 5 PM Sunday: 1 AM, 2 AM, 1 PM, 2 PM, and 10 PM

steps.title: Use trending sounds and hashtags.
steps.content: Use trending sounds and hashtags. Being up-to-date on the latest trends can increase your chances of landing on the FYP. Just be sure to include sounds and hashtags that are relevant to your content and make sense with your brand. [8] X Research source For example, you wouldnâ€™t want to add #foodtok to a video of you dancing, but you could add #dancetutorial or a hashtag for a specific dance challenge. To find popular sounds, tap the â€œ+â€ button on your FYP, then click â€œAdd soundâ€ at the top of the screen. Once a new page opens, click on the â€œTikTok Viralâ€ playlist to see what songs are trending. To find popular hashtags, hit the magnifying glass in the upper righthand corner of your FYP and browse through the results under â€œYou may likeâ€â€”the results with a red arrow are currently trending.

steps.title: Engage with your followers and other content creators.
steps.content: Engage with your followers and other content creators. High engagement is the key to going viral on TikTok, so encourage your viewers to comment, like, save, or share your videos with friends. To engage with other TikTokers, use Duets and Stitches with their videos, or message them to see if theyâ€™d be interested in collaborating with you. [9] X Research source

steps.title: For your pleasure
steps.content: For your pleasure On X (formerly Twitter), the acronym â€œFYPâ€ often means â€œfor your pleasure.â€ People write â€œFYPâ€ when they tag another user in a post that they believe theyâ€™ll find interesting or enjoyable. â€œHereâ€™s a photo I took of the Great Barrier Reef. FYP @NatGeoâ€ â€œSitting courtside at the Knicks game tonight. FYP @myboyfriendâ€ â€œSome awesome shots from the concert yesterday. FYP @theweekndâ€

steps.title: Final year project
steps.content: Final year project If youâ€™re talking about education, â€œFYPâ€ stands for â€œfinal year project.â€ It typically refers to the project or academic task that you complete during the final year of your undergraduate studies.

steps.title: Fixed your post
steps.content: Fixed your post In online forums, the acronym â€œFYPâ€ is often short for â€œfixed your post.â€ People use it to reference another userâ€™s post and make â€œcorrectionsâ€ if they have a different opinion. Them: â€œNickelback sucks.â€ You: â€œNickelback rocks. FYP.â€

steps.title: PFP
steps.content: PFP On Instagram, TikTok, and X, the acronym â€œPFPâ€ is short for â€œprofile picture.â€ It refers to the small icon or avatar that accompanies your posts and represents you as a user on social media. [10] X Research source â€œI love your new PFP!â€ â€œYour new PFP is ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥â€ â€œJust saw that you updated your PFP. Looking sharp!â€

steps.title: POV
steps.content: POV Commonly used on TikTok, the acronym â€œPOVâ€ stands for â€œpoint of view.â€ Creators often include â€œPOVâ€ in captions and on-video text when they want the viewer to watch a video from their own perspective. This format allows the audience to feel like theyâ€™re present in a specific situation, whether itâ€™s going on a first date, getting a paycheck, or being late to class. â€œPOV: your dad when you get kidnappedâ€ â€œPOV: youâ€™re the popular girl in high schoolâ€ â€œPOV: youâ€™re picking up your sister from jailâ€

steps.title: CEO
steps.content: CEO On social media, being the CEO of something means youâ€™re the best at that thing. The â€œthingâ€ is usually a random or niche field, but it can also be a legitimate area of expertise. Oftentimes, users say that theyâ€™re the â€œCEO of somethingâ€ to be funny or sarcastic. [11] X Research source â€œSheâ€™s the CEO of contouring.â€ â€œIâ€™m the CEO of overthinking everything.â€ â€œHeâ€™s the CEO of hosting themed parties.â€
